intro: Pimpinella buchananii subsp. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of biodiversity in its natural habitat.
